transportAdvice: Kandy's hilly terrain makes walking practical within the city center and lakeside areas, though steep streets can be tiring. Public buses connect major attractions and surrounding towns, and three-wheelers (tuk-tuks) are widely available for short hops; taxis can be arranged through hotels for longer journeys.

weather.description: Dry and pleasant with cool evenings, making it one of the more comfortable months to visit Kandy.
Warm and largely dry with good visibility, ideal for sightseeing and temple visits.
Temperatures begin to rise and conditions remain mostly dry, though occasional afternoon showers are possible.
The first inter-monsoon season brings increased rainfall and humidity, with frequent afternoon thunderstorms.
The southwest monsoon arrives, bringing heavy and persistent rain that can disrupt outdoor activities.
Continued monsoon rains keep conditions wet and overcast throughout the month.
Rain remains frequent but the famous Esala Perahera festival typically takes place this month, drawing large crowds.
Rainfall begins to ease slightly toward month's end, though humidity stays high and showers are still common.
A transitional period with gradually reducing rainfall and warm, humid conditions.
The second inter-monsoon season brings a return of heavy showers and thunderstorms.
Rain begins to taper off as the northeast monsoon establishes itself, though wet spells are still likely.
Conditions become drier and more pleasant toward year's end, with cooler evenings returning.
